definitions.definition: A small individual part of something larger; a detail, a point.
(chiefly in plural) A particular case; an individual thing as opposed to a whole class. (Opposed to generals, universals.)
Pertaining only to a part of something; partial.

definitions.example: I couldn't find the particular model you asked for, but I hope this one will do.

definitions.definition: Specialised; characteristic of a specific person or thing.
definitions.example: I don't appreciate your particular brand of cynicism.

definitions.definition: Known only to an individual person or group; confidential.
Distinguished in some way; special (often in negative constructions).
Of a person, concerned with, or attentive to, details; minute; precise; fastidious.
definitions.example: He is very particular about his food and if it isn't cooked to perfection he will send it back.

definitions.definition: Concerned with, or attentive to, details; minute; circumstantial; precise.
definitions.example: a full and particular account of an accident
a particular estate, or one precedent to an estate in remainder

definitions.definition: Forming a part of a genus; relatively limited in extension; affirmed or denied of a part of a subject.
definitions.example: a particular proposition, opposed to "universal", e.g. (particular affirmative) "Some men are wise"; (particular negative) "Some men are not wise".
